summary: The Counternarcotics Enhancement Act mandates the Director of National Intelligence to create an action plan to improve collaboration, coordination, and cooperation with the Mexican government regarding counternarcotics efforts. It requires intelligence community elements to assess their relationships with Mexican entities, develop strategies to strengthen counter-narcotics cooperation, and recommend resource allocations. The DNI is then required to submit these elements' submissions, along with a comprehensive action plan, to congressional intelligence committees, detailing proposed changes in authorities or resources needed for effective implementation in fiscal year 2026. The bill specifically addresses the Opioid crisis, through targeting drug trafficking.
